Question: For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: You are waiting at a railway level crossing and the red lights continue to flash after the train has passed. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on carefully while the lights are still flashing
Stay stopped until the lights stop flashing
Check both ways and then drive on
Wait for 15 seconds and then drive on

Question: Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
What should you do if you meet animals coming towards you on the road?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and move over to the left side of the road
Give a long blast with the horn on your vehicle
Give a lot of short toots with the horn on your vehicle

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer

Question: Which of your vehicle’s lights do you have on if you are driving in fog?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: You may use a right turn bay to overtake a vehicle travelling straight ahead.
You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When traffic is merging, what is a good rule to follow?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to make room behind
Let one vehicle in and then go
Let two vehicles in and then go

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
When must you turn your vehicle headlights on?

Answers.Answer: 15 minutes after sunset until 15 minutes before sunrise
30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise
45 minutes after sunset until 45 minutes before sunrise
1 hour after sunset until 1 hour before sunrise

Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: You can stop or park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if someone stays with the vehicle who can move it.
What is the safest way to drive up to intersections?

Answers.Answer: At such a speed that you can stop if you have to

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What rule should you use to judge a safe following distance in wet or frosty conditions if driving a car?
You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Question: You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
